source.title: Situating the default-mode network along a principal gradient of macroscale cortical organization

confidence_rationale: Strong evidence for continuous cortical gradients tempers overly discrete mode interpretations while still compatible with regime regions.

mapping.source_claim_statement: The default-mode network is positioned on a continuous macroscale cortical gradient rather than an isolated categorical module.
mapping.ree_translation: Mixed for ARC-016: supports mode regions in control space, but weakens strict hard-discrete mode partitioning assumptions.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Gradient geometry does not by itself specify dynamic transition policies or commitment thresholds.
mapping.source_context: Macroscale connectome-gradient analysis linking unimodal to transmodal cortex.

confidence_components.notes: Important boundary evidence against literal discrete-mode claims.
